oppression.question: Did I harass others through my words, actions, or decisions that reflected unjust authority or favoritism?
oppression.description: It's a sin to execute an unjust and cruel exercise of power or authority over others instead of respecting the God-given dignity of every human person.

extracted_data_phrases: rather than seeing them in their full humanity
lust.question: Did you reduce others to their usefulness, rather than seeing them in their full humanity?
lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

lust.description: While not sexual in nature, this sin is still a form of lust in that it objectifies others who are created in God's image and possesses inherent dignity,

envy.question: Have I felt envious when seeing others' achievements, wealth, or good fortune?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: in such a way that was unbecoming of my dignity
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others in such a way that was unbecoming of my dignity?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control in my words, speaking to others with impertinent or unseemly language?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in using language that was unbecoming or hurtful to others
incontinence.question: Did you lack self-control in using language that was unbecoming or hurtful to others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, particularly when dining out or enjoying special occasions?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: in eating or drinking beyond what 's reasonable
gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, particularly when enjoying social gatherings or leisure activities?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in discussing others' private affairs, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: through casual conversations or social interactions
gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs, even if what was shared was true, through casual conversations or social interactions?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing someone's private affairs, even if it was true, that would cause them embarrassment or hurt?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: in paid activities on a Sunday , when otherwise possible to avoid them
on a Sunday , when otherwise possible to avoid them
impiety.question: Did I engage in paid activities on a Sunday, when otherwise possible to avoid them?
impiety.description: It's irreverent to work on a Sunday as it's a holy day of rest, worship, and a day of protest against the servitude of work and the worship of money (CCC).

impurity.question: Have I used practices to prevent pregnancy?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

impurity.question: Did I use certain practices, substances, or objects to prevent pregnancy within any marital union?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.

impurity.question: Did you use certain practices to prevent pregnancy, especially in ways that intentionally separate the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage?
impurity.description: This sin intentionally separates the unitive and procreative purposes of marriage and violates the proper use of one's sexuality.
